backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor for the pool scorekeeper app, handling access control, user approval, profiles, and match entry storage/retrieval across multiple game modes (Accepting Gifts, Straight Shot, APA Practice).
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report specifying a single change: updating the candlestick series legend label in StraightShotTrendChart.tsx from 'Candle (day)' to 'Shots (day)'.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Auto-generated summary document describing the purpose and key behaviors of each frontend source file in the project.
frontend/docs/v48-modecard-resume-button: Documentation for a UI-only change in ModeCard.tsx that reorders buttons so 'Start New Game' appears before 'Resume Game', with a testing checklist.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS stylesheet defining light and dark mode CSS custom properties for the app's design token system (colors, radius, chart colors, sidebar).
frontend/index.html: Root HTML entry point for the Vite/React frontend, mounting the app into a div#root and loading the main.tsx module.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that configures TanStack Router with all application routes, wraps the app in ThemeProvider and AuthGate, and provides a shared error fallback UI.
frontend/src/components/accepting-gifts/: Table component displaying win/loss records grouped by starting ball count (2–7) for the Accepting Gifts game mode.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaBallButto: Circular button component representing a pool ball in APA practice mode, supporting unscored/playerA/playerB/dead states with color-coded styling and locked/disabled states.
frontend/src/components/apa/apaBallStyle: Provides shared utility functions for APA 9-Ball rack scoring, including ball point value calculation with the one-away rule and rack totals computation for both players.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaRackScori: React component for scoring a single rack in an APA 9-ball match, managing ball states (unscored/playerA/playerB/dead), defensive shots, innings flow, and emitting rack completion data when all balls are assigned.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaResultsSu: Displays a post-match summary card showing each player's skill level, points needed/earned, defensive shots, innings, PPI, and the team match point outcome with winner highlighted.
frontend/src/components/apa/MatchupAnaly: A dropdown button that lists unique opponents from official APA matches and calls a callback when one is selected; shows a disabled state if no opponents exist.
Extended matchup analysis dropdown that filters official and optionally practice matches against a selected opponent, then renders a MatchupAnalysisPanel with the filtered match history.
Panel component that aggregates and displays head-to-head match history (official and practice) against a specific opponent, computing win/loss outcomes and PPI for each match.
frontend/src/components/apa/RealApaMatch: Form component for creating or editing an official APA match log entry, with fields for date, opponent, skill levels, scores, innings, and defensive shots, including validation and backend save/update mutations.
frontend/src/components/apa/useApaInning: React hook that manages the innings counter and active player turn state for APA 9-Ball matches, incrementing innings when the bottom player ends their turn.
frontend/src/components/auth/AuthGate.ts: Authentication and access-control gate component that blocks rendering of children until the user is logged in via Internet Identity and approved (when invite-only mode is active).
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Button component that handles Internet Identity login and logout, clearing the React Query cache on logout.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: Dialog component that prompts newly authenticated users to create a profile (name and APA skill level) and allows existing users to edit their profile.
frontend/src/components/history/MatchHis: Table component displaying past matches with selectable rows, bulk delete functionality, and columns for date, results, PPI, and aPPI.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout: Root layout component rendering the sticky header with navigation, login/profile controls, an admin shield button, and a footer wrapping all page content via an Outlet.
frontend/src/components/matches/DeleteMa: Renders a destructive button that opens an AlertDialog confirmation before deleting a match, then navigates to history or calls an optional callback.
frontend/src/components/matches/EndMatch: A reusable AlertDialog component for confirming the end of a match, with configurable title, description, confirm text, and pending/disabled states.
frontend/src/components/matches/MatchSum: Displays a summary card for a single match showing mode, date, and narrative details, with a button to navigate to the match detail page.
frontend/src/components/ModePill.tsx: Small presentational component that renders a styled rounded pill/badge displaying a game mode name, used in match history views.
frontend/src/components/navigation/ModeC: A navigation card for a game mode that shows start and optional resume buttons based on whether an in-progress session exists in local storage.
frontend/src/components/players/ApaAggre: Renders Recharts line charts visualizing APA performance trends (PPI, aPPI, points, defensive shots) over time from aggregated data points.
frontend/src/components/straight-shot/St: Displays a bar chart histogram of Straight Shot session shot-count frequencies using Recharts.
Renders a table summarizing Straight Shot win/loss records grouped by total ball count, including the first win date.
Renders a candlestick-style composed chart showing daily open/close/high/low shot counts and an average trend line for Straight Shot sessions.
frontend/src/dev/straight-shot-spot-chec: A manual QA checklist for verifying that the Straight Shot game mode remains functional after unrelated code changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: A React Query hook that creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor, invalidating dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useActorRetry.ts: Provides a `retryConnection` callback that clears and refetches the cached actor query without a page refresh.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and hook for Internet Identity authentication on the ICP platform, managing login/logout state, identity persistence, and AuthClient creation with configurable options.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for all backend actor interactions including match CRUD operations, user profile management, and APA/game-specific data queries and mutations.
frontend/src/index.css: Global CSS entry point that imports Tailwind directives and defines CSS custom properties for light and dark theme color tokens used throughout the app.
frontend/src/lib/accepting-gifts/accepti: Defines the 12-level Accepting Gifts progression system with level metadata, and provides utility functions for clamping indices, retrieving levels, and computing the next baseline level after a match result.
Manages Accepting Gifts in-session game state, providing functions to apply attempt results and prepare the next set after a race-to-7 set completes.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaAggregateStats.t: Extracts and aggregates per-player APA match data points (PPI, aPPI, points, defensive shots) from both practice and official APA match logs, with independent null-safe field cleaning.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaEqualizer.ts: Defines the APA 9-Ball Equalizer skill level to points-to-win mapping and provides helper functions for validating and formatting skill levels and point targets.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaMatchPoints.ts: Implements the APA 9-Ball 20-point match point conversion chart, mapping loser skill level and points pocketed to win/loss point outcomes for all skill levels 1–9.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaPracticeMatchOut: Computes APA Practice match outcome by identifying the loser's skill level and points pocketed, then returning winner/loser match points using the APA match points chart.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaScoring.ts: Defines APA 9-ball rack scoring constants, validation utilities, and player stat aggregation including PPI calculation.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaSkillLevelPredic: Provides functions to predict APA skill levels (1–9) from PPI and aPPI values using multiple sets of range tables for both the Official APA tab and detailed stats views.
frontend/src/lib/apa/officialApaExpected: Contains the official APA Expected PPI lookup table indexed by win-percentage bucket and skill level (SL2–SL7), with helpers to bucket a win percentage and retrieve the expected PPI value.
Derives an Official APA match outcome ('win', 'loss', or 'unknown') from skill levels and scores by comparing each player's score against their points-to-win target.
frontend/src/lib/apa/officialApaPpi.ts: Calculates Official APA PPI (score divided by adjusted innings) and aPPI (max of PPI and table-expected PPI for wins only) for individual matches, using historical win percentage for the expected PPI lookup.
frontend/src/lib/history/matchHistoryRow: Builds a structured narrative (mode name pill + details string) for match history rows, handling Official APA, Practice APA, Straight Shots, and Accepting Gifts match types.
frontend/src/lib/matches/effectiveMatchD: Determines the effective timestamp for a match by preferring the user-entered date for Official APA logs and falling back to the stored dateTime, with a helper to format the result as a human-readable string.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuilders.t: Builds an official APA match log record from form inputs, deriving win/loss outcome from skill levels and scores, and re-exports other match builders from matchBuildersOriginal.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuildersOr: Provides builder functions for APA 9-Ball practice matches, Accepting Gifts matches, and Straight Shot matches, constructing typed MatchLogRecord objects with computed outcomes and player stats.
frontend/src/lib/session/inProgressSessi: Centralized helpers for reading, writing, and clearing per-mode in-progress game state in sessionStorage, with typed keys for APA Practice, Accepting Gifts, and Straight Shot modes.
frontend/src/lib/stats/acceptingGiftsPer: Computes win/loss counts for Accepting Gifts matches grouped by starting ball count (2–7) from match history.
frontend/src/lib/stats/acceptingGiftsSta: Computes summary statistics for Accepting Gifts matches, including total sessions and a rolling average of ending object ball counts over the last N sessions.
Computes official APA match statistics including win rate, average PPI over the last 10 matches, and best aPPI over the last 20 matches in chronological order.
frontend/src/lib/stats/straightShotStats: Computes Straight Shot drill statistics including rolling and lifetime shot averages, lowest score, trend data, histogram data, and a win/loss summary table.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app with React Query and Internet Identity providers wrapping the root App component.
frontend/src/pages/accepting-gifts/Accep: Main game page for the Accepting Gifts drill that manages session state, handles attempt inputs, tracks scores, and saves completed matches to the backend.
Static informational card component that displays the rules, level system, match format, and progression rules for the Accepting Gifts drill.
Start page for the Accepting Gifts drill that lets users select a starting level, handles in-progress session detection, and initializes a new game session in sessionStorage.
Live APA 9-ball practice match game page that tracks rack-by-rack scoring, manages session state, and saves the completed match to the backend.
frontend/src/pages/apa/PracticeStartPage: Setup page for an APA 9-ball practice match where users enter player names, skill levels, and determine the lag winner before navigating to the game page.
frontend/src/pages/apa/RealApaMatchEditP: Edit page for an existing official APA match log that loads match data by ID and renders the RealApaMatchForm pre-populated with existing values.
frontend/src/pages/apa/RealApaMatchPlace: Page for manually logging an official APA match after the fact by rendering the RealApaMatchForm in create mode.
frontend/src/pages/auth/AccessNotAllowed: Displays an access-denied page for invite-only apps, allowing users to submit an access request via the useRequestApproval hook and showing a confirmation message on success.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchDetailsP: Shows detailed information for a single match by ID, including APA-specific stats (PPI, aPPI, innings, skill levels) and provides navigation back to history and to player aggregate pages.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchHistoryP: Renders a paginated, sortable match history list with tabs for All/APA/Gifts/Straight modes, supporting both card and table view modes with preference persisted in localStorage.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Home page displaying four mode cards (Official APA Match Log, APA Practice, Accepting Gifts, Straight Shot) and a link to Match History for authenticated users.
frontend/src/pages/owner/OwnerApprovalsP: Admin-only page for managing user access approvals, allowing the owner to approve or reject individual or all pending requests and toggle invite-only mode.
frontend/src/pages/players/PlayerAggrega: Displays aggregate APA stats for a specific player (win rate, best-10-of-20 PPI/aPPI, predicted skill level) derived from official matches, with a matchup analysis dropdown.
frontend/src/pages/SmokeCheckPage.tsx: Post-deployment verification page with a checklist and navigation buttons to Home and Match History for confirming core routing works after a deployment.
frontend/src/pages/stats/StatsPage.tsx: Personal stats dashboard with tabbed views for APA, Straight Shot, and Accepting Gifts modes, showing charts, trend data, and a matchup analysis panel for the logged-in user.
frontend/src/pages/straight-shot/Straigh: React page component for an active Straight Shot drill session, allowing the user to track total shots, save the match to the backend, and navigate to history on completion.
Presentational card component that displays the rules and objective of the Straight Shot Strokes Drill, including win condition of 20 shots or fewer.
Start page for the Straight Shot drill that shows the player's profile name, moving average of last 10 sessions, and options to start a new or resume an in-progress session.
frontend/src/utils/errorText.ts: Utility function `extractErrorText` that converts unknown error values (strings, Error objects, or plain objects) into a readable English string.
frontend/src/utils/playerName.ts: Utility functions for normalizing and comparing player names case-insensitively.
frontend/src/utils/playerRoutes.ts: Single utility function that builds the aggregate stats route path for a given player name using URL encoding.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for reading, storing, and clearing URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage persistence support.
frontend/src/utils/withTimeout.ts: Utility function `withTimeout` that wraps a Promise in a race against a configurable timeout, rejecting with an error if the timeout is exceeded.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining the design system tokens (colors, border radius, animations, fonts) using OKLCH variables, with typography, container-queries, and animate plugins.
project_state.json: Project state metadata file tracking the current feature request to rename the candlestick legend label from 'Candle (day)' to 'Shots (day)' in the Straight Shot Trend Chart.
